clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Glucosamine is usually used in the treatment of osteoarthritis although its efficacy is still in question

contraindications.disease: Adverse effects are generally mild itching diarrhea heartburn nausea and vomiting
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Osteoarthritis is characterized by the progressive degeneration of cartilage glycosaminoglycans The formation of glucosamine is the rate limiting step in glycosaminoglycans synthesis thus the addition is glucosamine would in theory provide a building block towards the synthesis of glycosaminoglycans and thus slow down the progression of osteoarthritis Thus far however the results have not been conclusive
